newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
title: Ex-planning minister MA Mannan sent to jail, students stage protest to free him

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: Former planning minister and Sunamganj-3 MP MA Mannan has been sent to jail after he was arrested from his village home in Sunamganj.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: Meanwhile, students have blocked roads demanding the Awami League politician’s release.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: Sunamganj Judicial Magistrate Farhan Sadique ordered that he be sent to jail at 10am on Friday, said lawyer Masuk Alam.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: Earlier, Mannan was presented to the court in a case over an attack on students during the Anti-discrimination Student Movement.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: The prosecution petitioned for him to be remanded while the defence sought his bail. The judge then ordered the case to be heard by a speedy trial court.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: Students from different educational institutions blocked the Sunamganj-Sylhet highway to stage protests against the arrest of Mannan.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: They blocked the Shantiganj point of the highway from 10:30am to 11 am and held a demonstration. They demanded that Mannan be released soon or else threatened to escalate protests.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: Police arrested the former MP around 10:30pm on Thursday from his residence in Shantiganj’s Hijalbari.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: Mannan was arrested in connection with a case filed over an attack on students and civilians during the Anti-discrimination Student Movement in Sunamganj on Aug 4, said AFM Anwar Hossain Khan, a superintendent of police in Sunamganj.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: The Aug 4 attack in Sunamganj injured Jahur Ali from Eroakhai village. His brother Hafiz Ahmed filed a case on Sept 2 against Mannan and 98 others.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: A former bureaucrat, Mannan was first elected to the ninth parliament in 2008.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: In 2003, after retiring from the civil service, Mannan ran as an Awami League candidate in the 2005 by-election for the Sunamganj-3 seat but lost.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: However, he won in both the 2014 and 2018 general elections.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: In 2014, former prime minister Sheikh Hasina appointed him as state minister for planning, and four months later, he took on additional responsibilities at the finance ministry.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: After the 2018 general election, he was made planning minister.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: He won his fourth consecutive term in the Jan 7 general election but was not included in the cabinet. Instead, he was appointed chairman of the parliamentary standing committee on the planning ministry.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: While he was a minister and state-minister, Mannan played an important role in establishing the Sunamganj University of Science and Technology, Sunamganj Medical College, Textile College and other educational institutions.

newsitem: Protests as ex-minister MA Mannan sent to jail
description: Residents claim that Mannan had been staying at his home since the beginning of August, with locals guarding his residence. As a result, no attacks occurred on his house even after Aug 5.

Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
title: Banning student politics benefits ‘people in the shadows’: Fakhrul

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir views the decision to halt student politics at Dhaka University as a "bad move," believing it will benefit "people of the dark".

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: According to the BNP leader, "Politics should remain open. We should encourage healthy and positive politics."

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Speaking with journalists at the party chairperson’s office in Dhaka’s Gulshan on Saturday, he said: “I believe that if student politics is unhealthy, then national politics will not be healthy. And if leadership does not emerge from student politics, then leadership for the nation will not develop.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: “Be it in bureaucracy or politics, everything will come from here [students]. Our youth had become disinterested in politics because student politics had disappeared from educational institutions. Now they are starting to return.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: “If we stop student politics now, who will benefit? Those who work in the shadows, those who operate underground, they will benefit.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Instead of banning student politics, Fakhrul advised addressing issues like the occupation of halls, seat capture, and mass rooms.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: ‘DEPOLITICISATION IS NOT THE ANSWER’

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Fakhrul said, “Politics must exist, and it must be embraced. The decision to indefinitely suspend student politics at Dhaka University is, in my opinion, a bad step.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: “You can’t cut off the head to cure a headache. Let's identify the problem and try to solve it. Discuss the issues with the student organisations and find a solution.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Fakhrul agreed that student organisations should not act as mere extensions of political parties. “We can figure out what measures can be taken to address this by discussing it with the students. But can it be done forcefully? If so, how would this government be different from a military regime? I have to work through politics while staying within the realm of politics.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: ‘REFORMS UNSUSTAINABLE WITHOUT PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT’

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Fakhrul also commented on the reforms initiated by the interim government about politics and governance.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: “This reform—can it happen without the people? Reforms are for the people, the country, and the institutions, aren’t they? It would have been better to first speak with politicians and seek their proposals on what changes the public wants in these institutions.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: “The government is indeed disconnected from the people. No reform will be sustainable without public participation. There must be political commitment, and decisions must be made. Will you nationalise things or not? That’s a political decision. Will you prioritise hospitals or mega projects? That too is a political commitment, isn’t it?”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Fakhrul added, “You won’t achieve anything by imposing reforms. Talk to stakeholders, NGOs, teachers, professionals from all sectors, and then speak with the politicians.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: HOW CAN YOU AMEND CONSTITUTION WITHOUT A CONSTITUENT ASSEMBLY?

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Fakhrul also raised questions about the interim government's initiative to reform the constitution.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: “If you want to change the constitution, you first need to know what kind of changes the people want. To fundamentally alter the constitution or create a new one, you need a constituent assembly first. Without that, how can you change it?”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: He emphasised that legal changes cannot happen overnight. "If you want to make fundamental changes or write a new constitution, it should be done based on the people's mandate. For now, the necessary reforms for the election such as reforming the Election Commission, administration should be completed quickly to hold elections. In parliament, you can bring all necessary reforms."

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: FAKHRUL RECOMMENDS CURFEW IN THE HILL TRACTS, SAYS ‘DELAYS ARE COSTLY’

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Fakhrul also suggested that the interim government should act as a "revolutionary government". “This government took its oath under this constitution, right? So, you have to uphold that—you cannot deny it.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: “Those who have been given the responsibility are undoubtedly highly qualified experts. I believe they will do well, but they must also consider the people's needs.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: ‘THE LONGER THE DELAY IN ELECTIONS, THE GREATER THE HARM’

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: On the issue of elections, the BNP leader said, “I haven’t specified any exact timeframe, and I won’t. But the longer the delay, the greater the harm to the country, society, and politics.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: He reiterated that there is no alternative to political governance. “We believe that democracy is the best system of governance. You cannot run a state without politics. The state itself is a political entity.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: When asked about the consequences of the government staying in power for an extended period, Fakhrul said, “If anyone tries to make such a decision, it will be a mistake, and it will never work. It will be dangerous for the nation and create major problems.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: He commented, “It’s difficult to predict what those problems might be, but the people of Bangladesh won’t accept it.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: ‘HASINA SHOULD FACE LEGAL CASES AGAINST HER’

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Fakhrul also advised the ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina to face the legal cases against her.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: He said, “No one is above the law, she must come before the law.

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: “If she is truly a politician, she should face it, just as our leader [Khaleda Zia] did. She faced the court, and later went to jail... This is how a political leader should behave.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: When asked about bringing Hasina back to the country, Fakhrul said: “I’m sure the interim government is considering it. I don’t want to push them on this issue, but they should bring her to justice as soon as possible.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: ‘PRESSURE ON MEDIA STILL EXISTS’

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: During the exchange, Fakhrul posed a question to journalists. “You always ask me questions. This time I have a question for you. Is there still the same pressure on you as before? I’m curious. Is there still pressure on your owners?”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: A journalist responded, “There’s no pressure now.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: Fakhrul replied, “That’s not true. The pressure was there before, and it still exists. You just don’t want to say it.”

newsitem: Student politics ban will benefit ‘people of the dark’: Fakhrul
description: He also spoke about the conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts, suggesting that the imposition of a curfew could help control the situation, saying that delays in taking this step are doing harm.

title: Germany's far-right AfD on track for another state election win

newsitem: Far-right AfD on track to win another Germany state election
description: The far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) is predicted to come first in an election in Brandenburg on Sunday, seeking to build on gains in other eastern states this month and beat Chancellor Olaf Scholz's Social Democrats in a traditional stronghold.

newsitem: Far-right AfD on track to win another Germany state election
description: The AfD became the first far-right party to win a state election in Germany since World War Two, in Thuringia, on Sept 1 and just missed first place in Saxony.

newsitem: Far-right AfD on track to win another Germany state election
description: It is one of several far-right groups in Europe capitalising on worries over an economic slowdown, immigration and the Ukraine war - concerns that are particularly strong in formerly Communist-run eastern Germany.

newsitem: Far-right AfD on track to win another Germany state election
description: The party, which is unlikely to be able to govern because it is polling short of a majority and other parties would refuse to work with it, is also seeking to gain from discontent over infighting in Scholz's three-party federal coalition.

newsitem: Far-right AfD on track to win another Germany state election
description: "We urgently need a thorough course correction so the country does not go to the dogs," the AfD's lead candidate in Brandenburg, Hans-Christoph Berndt, said at a campaign event earlier this month.

newsitem: Far-right AfD on track to win another Germany state election
description: An AfD victory in the state election would be a particular embarrassment for the Social Democrats (SPD), which has won elections in Brandenburg and governed the state of 2.5 million people since reunification in 1990.

newsitem: Far-right AfD on track to win another Germany state election
description: It would also raise further questions about the suitability of Scholz, the least popular German chancellor on record, to lead the party into next year's election.

newsitem: Far-right AfD on track to win another Germany state election

newsitem: Far-right AfD on track to win another Germany state election

newsitem: Trump says he will not run again if he loses in November
